title: Ayesha Meera case closed as court accepts CBI final report
content: Bringing a 17 year legal battle to an end, the CBI Court accepts the agency’s report citing lack of legally sustainable evidence, with the victim’s parents unwilling to pursue further remedies due to financial constraints and dissatisfaction with the probe

title: On Mother Language Day, Kolkatans say language, not religion, must define human identity
content: The day is being observed worldwide since the year 2000; in India, West Bengal in particular celebrates Language Day with vigour, with most educational institutions organising events

title: J&K Government shattered dreams of youth by outsourcing 23,000 jobs: LoP Sunil Sharma
content: The BJP leader asked the Omar Abdullah government to rollback the order or face the "wrath of the youth".

title: Kuki-Zo MLA, attacked by mob in 2023 ethnic violence in Manipur, dies in Gurugram hospital
content: Vungzagin Valte, a third-time legislator who was also an adviser to former Chief Minister N. Biren Singh on tribal affairs, was attacked by the mob while leaving the Chief Minister’s office after attending a meeting

title: City hospital completes first heart transplantation
content: Dr. Dilip Ratti, Cardiothoracic and Vascular Surgery, said heart transplantation requires the most advanced life support infrastructure, like ECMO, ventricular assist devices, precise surgical execution, and seamless teamwork across multiple specialities

title: BJP would emerge as strong alternative force in Punjab, says Haryana CM
content: CM Nayab Saini blames ruling Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) for failing to curb drug menace; he asserts that the BJP remains fully committed to safeguarding its future

title: Subsidies, incentives of over 1,800 farmers blocked in Bihar for stubble burning
content: The Bihar Economic Survey (2025-26), recently tabled in the Assembly, noted that DBT registrations of 4,596 farmers were blocked in 2024; however, incidents of crop residue burning declined in 2025 compared to the previous year

title: Security forces detect, diffuse IED placed on roadside in Kashmir's Ganderbal district
content: The IED was kept inside a bag and placed on the roadside at Gulab Sheikh Mohalla near Kohestan Colony in the district's Safapora area

title: Sahyadri Arts College conducts survey to understand linguistic diversity on campus in Shivamogga
content: The survey results were presented during a programme organised to mark International Mother Language Day in the college on February 21

title: How are India’s DISCOMs in profit now?
content: From crushing losses of ₹54,000 crore in 2015, DISCOMs have tightened finances, reduced losses with Centre’s policy push to turn profitable

title: Nadda launches indigenous tetanus and adult diphtheria (Td) vaccine at CRI, Kasauli
content: With the formal launch of the Td vaccine, it has now been introduced for supply under the Universal Immunization Programme (UIP)

title: Shantmanu takes oath as Jammu and Kashmir SEC, hints at holding local body elections
content: “I am happy to formally begin my responsibilities. I will work with full commitment to ensure effective discharge of my duties,” Mr. Shantmanu said

title: V.D Satheesan questions Tantri’s arrest in Sabarimala gold case, asks SIT to clarify
content: The Congress leader said the SIT should make it clear to the public what offence the top priest committed in connection with the case

title: Vizianagaram terror conspiracy case: NIA files supplementary chargesheet involving two more accused

title: 9 CRPF personnel injured as vehicle falls into river in Srinagar
content: The injured CRPF personnel have been shifted to the SKIMS hospital in Soura, where their condition is said to be stable, they added.

title: Tourism Minister visits uru yard as Kerala Budget earmarks ₹5 crore for industry
content: The Minister said the allocation was aimed at enhancing the potential of the uru industry by linking it with the tourism sector and showcasing the traditional boat-building industry more prominently

title: Only 31.6% of poll promises fulfilled, says T.N. BJP in ‘report card’ on DMK’s five-year rule
content: BJP State vice-president R.N. Jayaprakash said the DMK had made 505 promises in its 2021 election manifesto. Of these, only 160 had been fulfilled

title: Kerala on the cusp of transformation, says CM
content: The secular fabric of Kerala, along with the decentralised development perspective envisioned by the State, played a major role in shaping Kerala, said Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan

title: Son of close aide of former Karnataka CM found dead in Bengaluru
content: According to preliminary information, Hemanth had an argument with his mother over giving jewellery to his sister after which he went to his room

title: ‘Toxic’: Yash confirms dual role, second avatar named ‘Ticket’
content: Yash is set to play dual roles — Raya and Ticket — in ‘Toxic’, directed by Geetu Mohandas and produced by KVN Productions

title: Udhayanidhi Stalin releases fourth volume of etymological dictionary of Tamil, Indo-European languages
content: The initiative is part of the Tamil Nadu Textbook and Educational Services Corporation’s collaboration with Oxford University Press to bring out a 12-volume comparative etymological dictionary of Tamil and Indo-European languages

title: Protest at AI Summit a well thought out conspiracy against India: Rijiju slams Congress
content: The Union Minister said while the entire country is condemning what the Congress did at the summit, the party and its leaders remain unapologetic

title: 75-year-old man loses ₹63.3 lakh to cyber fraudsters claiming to be ‘data protection board members’ and ‘Mumbai police personnel’
content: A person identifying himself as ‘Sandeep’ contacted the complainant via WhatsApp video call claiming to be a ‘Mumbai Police officer’, and threatened legal action

title: Anbumani criticises DMK over teacher recruitment, flags staffing gaps in schools and colleges
content: In a statement, Dr. Anbumani said the government’s claim of appointing 11,688 teachers over the past five years was inadequate, given that more than one lakh classrooms reportedly function without teachers

title: Joint maritime mechanism in Indian Ocean Region will be based on consensus: Navy Chief
content: Admiral Tripathi noted that the idea of closer operational cooperation was well accepted and said modalities of a joint task force would be worked out collectively

title: Rameswaram fishermen go on day-long strike against arrests by Sri Lankan Navy
content: About three days ago, 22 fishermen from Rameswaram and Mandapam, who were fishing in the Palk Strait, were arrested along with four of their trawlers by the Sri Lankan Navy near Neduntheevu and Katchatheevu islets

title: MUDA case complainant and RTI activist Snehamayi Krishna arrested by Bengaluru cyber crime police

content: Police teams focused on preventing the illegal transportation of narcotic drugs, and other suspicious materials into the city

title: NCP-SP MLA Rohit Pawar writes to PM Modi seeking ouster of Civil Aviation Minister

content: Hundreds of Form 7 applications seeking deletion of voter names surface mysteriously in Rajasthan’s Chohtan Assembly constituency.

content: The Goa Chief Minister said the actions of the Youth Congress at the AI Summit amount to ‘political recklessness’ and tarnish the country's image

title: CFTRI-Mysuru workshop participants discuss how to reduce salt in Indian cuisine to counter rise in hypertension and diabetes
content: With rising non-communicable diseases, such as hypertension and diabetes, national priorities for 2025–26, supported by the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI), emphasizes gradual salt and sugar reduction, front-of-pack labelling, and industry-led reformulation

title: Cordon-and-search operation in Ahobilam; more than 280 liquor bottles seized
content: Nearly 50 police officers and personnel under the supervision of Allagadda Deputy Superintendent of Police K. Pramod conducted the operation

title: Man kills sister over inter-faith relationship in Uttar Pradesh; father justifies act

title: Karnataka signs LoI with European innovation event platform VivaTech

title: BJP workers show black flags to Rahul Gandhi in Mumbai over Youth Congress AI summit protest
content: A group of BJP supporters staged a protest at Mulund toll naka and raised slogans against the Congress leader, for consistently opposes the initiatives of Prime Minister Narendra Modi

content: The Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh said farmers who insure their crops are entitled to financial aid in case of losses caused by disasters

title: Reciprocal tariffs are gone, but several other U.S. tariffs are still hitting Indian exporters

title: Five years of DMK rule translated Dravidian ideology into practical governance: Speaker Appavu

title: T.N. CM Stalin extends International Mother Language Day greetings

title: Militant arrested in Manipur's Imphal West

title: India now faces lower tariff rate of 10% with Trump’s proclamation on new levies after U.S. Supreme Court verdict

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly election | DMK forms committee for seat-sharing talks
content: In a press release, general secretary Duraimurugan said former Union Minister and party treasurer T.R. Baalu would head the committee

title: Youth Congress workers trespass on Health Minister Veena George’s official residence, lay funeral wreath to protest “increasing medical negligence”
content: The trespass on Ms George’s residence was the latest incident in the escalating Congress and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) campaign against the Left Democratic Front (LDF) following the startling discovery of an artery forceps in the abdomen of a woman who underwent surgery at the Government Medical College Hospital, Alappuzha, in 2021.

title: RSS defamation case: Rahul Gandhi appears in Bhiwandi court, names Sapkal as new guarantor
content: BJP workers show black flags to Rahul Gandhi in Mumbai; they call it response to Youth Congress protest at AI Summit

title: 'Alpha male' AI world shuts out women, says computing professor Wendy Hall
content: A 2024 UNESCO study found that large language models described women in domestic roles more often than men, who were more likely to be linked to words like "salary" and "career"

title: Twenty Point Programme chief cautions against populist schemes and freebies
content: The Chairman, accompanied by BJP district president Samanchi Srinivas and General Secretary Kadiri Naresh, received petitions from the public on civic and administrative issues

title: Businessman held for using fake number plate, 12 challans wrongly issued to another vehicle owner
content: The accused, Arif Khan, a resident of Ahmed Nagar in Masab Tank, was apprehended by Langar Houz police following inputs from the Hyderabad Traffic Police

title: India-U.S. trade deal has become an ‘ordeal’, Congress claims; Rahul Gandhi says ‘PM compromised’

title: Simultaneous elections are essential to become a developed nation by 2047: Chaudhary

title: Maharashtra’s Ladki Bahin Yojana: Waiting for ₹1,500
content: The Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana was rolled out ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly elections in mid-2024. It assured women between the ages of 21 and 65 a monthly stipend of ₹1,500, and the first tranche of payouts were made. After the Mahayuti government returned to power, it introduced mandatory e-KYC verification, which led to a reduction in the number of eligible beneficiaries, reports Vinaya Deshpande Pandit

title: CPI(M)’s Md Salim says there is no lobby in the party as estranged leader Pratik Ur Rahaman raises questions about lobbying and favouritism
content: The senior CPI(M) leader avoided any direct questions about the estranged leader amid the political buzz of Rahaman joining the ruling Trinamool Congress

title: Haryana Governor Ghosh says crimes against women decreased by 16% in 2025
content: The Governor said that the crime against women in respect of the Scheduled Castes has been declining for the last 4-5 years

title: MNS Chief Raj Thackeray stresses need for constructive Opposition, reaches out to ruling dispensation
content: Raj Thackeray, who met the Shiv Sena leader a day earlier, said his outreach was driven purely by civic concerns and not political realignment

title: U.P. court sentences ex-junior engineer, wife to death for sexual exploitation of 33 children

content: “This is an additional committee that will process and fast-track CAA applications in the State,” says a government  source; many applications have come from Matuas

content: Former boxing superstar Floyd Mayweather Jr. says he is unretiring and will resume his undefeated career after his planned exhibition bout against Mike Tyson.

title: Klaebo 1st athlete to win 6 golds at Winter Games
content: Norway's Johannes Hoesflot Klaebo completed his historic gold medal sweep of the men's cross-country skiing events on Saturday by winning his sixth race and set the record for the most golds by one athlete in a single Winter Olympics.

title: UCLA's Cronin apologizes to player for ejection
content: UCLA coach Mick Cronin said Friday he apologized to Steven Jamerson II for sending the center to the locker room late in a blowout loss at No. 15 Michigan State after he committed a hard foul.

title: Smith-Njigba: Believe I deserve to be top-paid WR

title: The British Royal Family Faces Its Worst Crisis In 90 Years

title: "I Will Never Be A Coward": Siddaramaiah Flags "Conspiracies" In Cryptic Post

title: AI Will Enhance Efficiency, Not Replace Humans, Says Karan Adani

title: 88 Nations Adopt New Delhi Declaration, Back India's "AI For All" Vision

title: Rs 30,000 Wedding Fraud: Cow Vigilante Bittu Bajrangi's Baraat Returns Home Without Bride

title: Award For BJP MP, Language Push: Trinamool's Rajbanshi Outreach Before Polls
content: The Rajbanshis are a scheduled caste community concentrated in North Bengal, especially in districts like Cooch Behar, Jalpaiguri, Darjeeling, Malda, and Murshidabad.

title: How The H-1B Visa Debate Is Fuelling Racism And Hate Speech In US
content: A regular City Council meeting in Texas turned heated this month as residents clashed over the federal H-1B visa programme. Speakers in Frisco City Council in Dallas invoked racist tropes and conspiracy theories targeting the city's Indian community.

title: Wagner's African Reign Ends, Russian Intelligence Now Pulls The Strings

content: Five people were killed, and six sustained serious injuries after a speeding bus crashed into their van on a national highway in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district in the early hours of Saturday, police said.

title: Rohit Pawar Seeks Minister's Resignation Over Ajit Pawar Plane Crash

title: Sam Altman Was Asked If He Would Be Friends With Elon Musk Again. His Response

content: BJP maintains that both the CBI and the CBFC function as independent statutory bodies and that there is no political interference.

title: ‘Noted the judgement’: Govt says India studying US top court ruling on Trump tariffs
content: India is closely examining the fallout from the US Supreme Court's decision to strike down President Trump's unilateral tariffs. Following the ruling, Trump announced a new 10% global tariff, asserting that existing national security tariffs remain. He also stated that the trade deal with India, where India pays tariffs, is unaffected.

title: UP court orders FIR against Swami Avimukteshwaranand in sexual exploitation case
content: A special POCSO court in Prayagraj has ordered the police to register an FIR against Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati and his disciple over sexual exploitation allegations. This directive follows a complaint filed by Ashutosh Brahmachari Maharaj. The move occurs amidst ongoing controversy surrounding Swami Avimukteshwaranand, including a recent protest over being prevented from a ritual dip at Sangam.

title: T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav hints at India's XI vs South Africa in Super Eight
content: Suryakumar Yadav dismissed rumors of Sanju Samson replacing Abhishek Sharma or Tilak Varma, emphasizing confidence in the current lineup. He addressed concerns about Abhishek's form by highlighting the threat he poses to opponents. Yadav also defended Tilak Varma's cautious approach, stating it aligns with team strategy.

title: 'I've best legal team': Indian-American lawyer who argued against Trump tariffs
content: Neal Katyal hailed his legal team as the "best in the world" after the US Supreme Court struck down Donald Trump's global tariffs as illegal. The ruling decisively affirmed that only Congress, not the president, possesses the authority to impose taxes on Americans, reinforcing constitutional governance and the separation of powers.

title: Bezos's ex-wife's record $7.2bn donation in 2025 called 'bad donation', Musk agrees
content: Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott has donated billions rapidly, but Y Combinator CEO Garry Tan criticizes her approach, calling it "bad" due to a lack of oversight and accountability. Tan argues this "spray and pray" method can lead to mismanagement and unintended negative consequences for recipient organizations.

title: Eng captain says excluding Pakistan players from The Hundred would be a 'shame'
content: England captain Harry Brook expressed disappointment over potential exclusions of Pakistani players from The Hundre. He stated it would be a "shame" for the tournament's quality and fan engagement. Several Indian-owned franchises in The Hundred also own IPL teams, where Pakistani players haven't featured since 2009.

title: Trump slams US Supreme Court over ‘foreign sway,’ targets India-linked firms & attorneys
content: President Trump fiercely attacked the Supreme Court after it struck down his tariffs, accusing the justices of being "lapdogs for the radical left" and influenced by foreign interests. He specifically targeted Indian-American attorneys involved in the case. The ruling, a 6-3 decision, reinforced Congress's trade powers, marking a significant setback for the President's executive actions.

title: Mira Murati's Thinking Machines loses top exec to Sam Altman's OpenAI amid spat
content: OpenAI continues to poach top talent from Mira Murati's Thinking Machines Lab, with Jolene Parish being the latest executive to return to the ChatGPT maker. This follows the departures of CTO Barret Zoph, Luke Metz, and Sam Schoenholz. The exodus highlights a fierce talent war, with Zoph's exit reportedly stemming from alleged "unethical conduct" and workplace relationship issues.

title: Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna's wedding plans unveiled
content: Reports suggest Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are set to tie the knot on February 26 in a private Udaipur ceremony, followed by a March 4 Hyderabad reception.  The couple, recently spotted at the airport, is reportedly enhancing security for the three-day festivities, which will include haldi and sangeet.  Their reunion in 'Ranabaali' is also anticipated.

title: Chase Elliott net worth: Inside his $12 million salary, sponsorships, and speedway success
content: Chase Elliott's impressive career earnings, estimated at $12 million, stem from more than just race wins. His lucrative Hendrick Motorsports contract, reportedly $8 million annually until 2027, combined with enduring sponsor loyalty from NAPA and Chevrolet, solidifies his status as NASCAR's most marketable star.  His consistent performance and approachable brand build a powerful financial foundation.

title: CEO Pichai thanks Google India, shares photo with Gill after AI Summit
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai blended cricket and code during a visit to the Gurugram office, meeting cricketer Shubman Gill. Pichai's trip also focused on India's AI leadership, urging global collaboration to solve world problems. He emphasized Google's 'full-stack' commitment to supporting India's AI advancements and its role in the Pax Silica initiative.

title: 14-year-old Dalit girl dies by suicide after molester gets bail
content: A 14-year-old Dalit girl in Lakhimpur Kheri was found dead after allegedly being threatened by a man accused of molesting her, who was recently released on bail. Her family claims she was under immense stress following the threats. An FIR has been registered against the accused for abetment of suicide and under the SC/ST Act.

title: T20 World Cup: When and where to watch IND vs SA live?
content: India will start their Super 8 campaign in the T20 World Cup 2026 against South Africa in Ahmedabad, with coach Morne Morkel confident batters will improve against spin. Despite struggles, India have posted big totals and plan to accelerate after building a base. India also face Zimbabwe and West Indies next. The match starts at 7 PM IST and will be live on Star Sports and Jio Hotstar.

title: ‘Inspired by Nepal’s Gen-Z protests’: 4 Youth Congress workers sent to 5-day custody for 'topless' protest
content: A Delhi court granted police five-day custody of four Youth Congress workers who staged a shirtless protest at the AI summit venue. Police allege a conspiracy to defame India, citing anti-national slogans and T-shirts targeting the Prime Minister. Investigators are probing potential foreign funding and a larger plot, with three officers reportedly injured during the incident.

title: Meet Asha Sharma: Indian-origin executive named CEO of Microsoft Gaming
content: Microsoft has appointed Asha Sharma as the new CEO of its gaming division, succeeding Phil Spencer. Sharma, with a background in AI and platform leadership, aims to refocus on Xbox's core audience amidst industry challenges like slowing revenue and intense competition. This significant leadership shift signals a strategic reset for Xbox.

title: IND vs SA: Ahmedabad stadium stats, h2h, weather forecast and more
content: India will start their Super 8 campaign against South Africa in Ahmedabad, with coach Morne Morkel confident batters will soon improve against spin. He believes India can post big totals and defend them with strong bowling. Ahmedabad is expected to be hot and dry, favouring batting-first teams. India lead the T20 head-to-head 18–12. India also face Zimbabwe and West Indies next.

title: Rajpal Yadav shares about the 'most difficult part' of being in Tihar jail after securing bail
content: In a heartfelt revelation, actor Rajpal Yadav, who was recently released on interim bail from Tihar Jail to attend his niece's wedding, noted that the greatest challenge during his incarceration was the emotional toll of being away from family. Emphasizing the importance of mental well-being, he maintained a positive outlook throughout his ordeal. Read on to know more in detail.

title: 'I've read & ... ': PM Modi's minister reacts to US top court trashing Trump's tariffs
content: Union minister Pralhad Joshi stated the Union government will study the US Supreme Court's ruling on tariffs before issuing an official statement, with the commerce and external affairs ministries handling the response.  Joshi also condemned the Indian Youth Congress's shirtless protest at the India AI Summit as shameful and disruptive.

title: Pakistan poverty explodes, inequality at 27-year high as economic crisis deepens
content: Pakistan's poverty has surged to an 11-year high of 29%, with 70 million people now in extreme poverty. Income inequality has also reached a 27-year peak of 32.7.  These increases are attributed to IMF stabilization policies, natural disasters, and weak growth, leading to a 12% fall in real household income over seven years.

title: Delhi on alert: Lashkar-e-Taiba ‘plotting’ IED attack near Red Fort, Chandni Chowk area
content: Delhi faces a terror threat alert near the Red Fort. Intelligence suggests Lashkar-e-Taiba may target a temple in Chandni Chowk with an IED. This potential strike aims to avenge a recent mosque blast in Pakistan. Prominent religious sites across India are on the group's radar. Security has been heightened in the capital's sensitive areas.

title: How a polio survivor from a humble family created a brand worth Rs 6,500 crore
content: Ram Chandra Agarwal, a polio survivor, transformed adversity into opportunity, starting with a photocopy shop before venturing into the garment business. He revolutionized retail with Vishal Mega Mart, offering affordable essentials to middle-class families. Despite a major setback in 2011, Agarwal made a powerful comeback with V2 Retail, solidifying his status as a retail icon.

title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: Rohit Pawar writes to PM Modi, demands Aviation minister's resignation
content: NCP (SP) leader Rohit Pawar has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to seek the resignation of Civil Aviation Minister K Ram Mohan Naidu pending an inquiry into the January 28 plane crash that killed Ajit Pawar. Pawar alleged potential links between the aircraft's owner, VSR, and the minister's party, demanding an independent probe into the incident and possible conspiracy.

title: Who is behind wheels? In high-profile car crashes, no one seems to be 'driving'
content: In India's high-profile luxury car crashes, a recurring defence emerges: a hired driver was at the wheel. Investigations often uncover conflicting claims, with authorities relying on CCTV, eyewitnesses, and forensic evidence to establish the true driver. This pattern highlights the challenges in determining responsibility and the vulnerability of drivers in such cases.

title: Pakistan vs New Zealand Super 8s: Venue stats, head-to-head, weather forecast
content: New Zealand's middle order faces a stern test against Pakistan's spin attack in their T20 World Cup Super Eight opener. The Kiwis' batting has yet to hit its stride, while Pakistan's spinners are well-accustomed to Colombo's slow conditions. Rain threatens to disrupt the crucial encounter, with no reserve day available.

title: 'I love my man': Mahieka Sharma's romantic reply to Hardik Pandya goes viral
content: Cricketer Hardik Pandya celebrated Mahieka Sharma's 25th birthday with a heartfelt Instagram post featuring a romantic video. Sharma reciprocated the affection, calling Pandya her "best gift." The couple, who confirmed their relationship in October 2025, has been seen together publicly since. Pandya was previously married to Natasa Stankovic.

title: T20 World Cup 2026: How worried should India be about their Super 8 opponents
content: The T20 World Cup's Super 8 stage marks the true beginning of the tournament, with India facing a tough path in Group 1. Despite an unbeaten group stage, concerns linger over opener Abhishek Sharma's form and the team's fielding ahead of crucial matches against South Africa, Zimbabwe, and the West Indies.

title: Heated arguments, then multiple gunshots: Man shoots wife dead over marital dispute in Faridabad
content: A 32-year-old woman, Sangeeta, was fatally shot by her husband, Dilip Yadav, during a marital dispute in Faridabad. The couple was undergoing divorce proceedings. Dilip, accompanied by family, confronted Sangeeta at her parents' home, leading to an argument and the fatal shooting. Both Dilip and his brother-in-law are currently at large.

title: BJP protests nationwide in response to Congress' 'topless' AI Summit protest
content: BJP staged nationwide protests after Indian Youth Congress workers disrupted the India AI Impact Summit, displaying slogans against PM Modi. Four IYC leaders were arrested. BJP workers also showed black flags to Rahul Gandhi in Mumbai, accusing the Congress of an 'anti-national' act and demanding an apology for the 'shameful' summit disruption.

title: Ranbir Kapoor family leases 5 floors for 20 years for New RK studios
content: In a bold move to honor the RK Studios heritage, Ranbir Kapoor is set to transform five floors in Andheri East into a cutting-edge facility. This remarkable studio will cover a vast 250,000 sq ft and include top-notch virtual production spaces, VFX studios, cutting-edge music and editing suites, exclusive screening rooms, and opulent green rooms. Read on to know more in detail.

title: 'KHxRK' reunion: Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan reunite for a quirky film
content: Superstars Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan have reunited for a quirky film, tentatively titled 'KHxRK', with Nelson Dilipkumar directing. The promo, released today, has generated significant buzz, hinting at a blend of humor, nostalgia, and visual appeal. Anirudh Ravichander is composing the music for this highly anticipated project, promising a vintage cinematic experience for fans after a 45-year gap.

title: Footage shows highway swallowed by gas cloud after Chile truck explosion — watch
content: A liquefied gas truck explosion on a highway in Santiago, Chile, resulted in at least four fatalities and 17 injuries. The blast, which occurred in the Renca district, sent a large gas cloud across the highway and damaged numerous vehicles. President Gabriel Boric confirmed government teams are assisting affected populations due to smoke in the area.

title: New Zealand wary of Usman Tariq threat but back familiarity against Pakistan
content: The Super 8 stage kicks off with a crucial clash between Pakistan and New Zealand in Colombo. Pakistan holds a slight edge due to their spin attack, particularly mystery spinner Usman Tariq. New Zealand, familiar with Pakistan's bowling, will rely on their middle order to counter the threat.

title: What’s next as US Supreme Court sends Trump's trade policy into flux
content: The Supreme Court ruled President Trump cannot use emergency powers for certain tariffs, impacting his trade strategy but not the trade war. Despite this, Trump announced new tariffs under the Trade Act of 1974, aiming for similar revenue despite a more complex legal process. Importers face ongoing uncertainty as the administration navigates new legal avenues for tariff enforcement.

title: Ram Charan and Upasana Konidela join Allu Arjun’s pre-wedding bash
content: Allu Sirish and Nayanika Reddy are gearing up for their big day on March 6, with vibrant pre-wedding events lighting up the festivities! Family and friends, including beloved figures Ram Charan and Upasana, gathered at a private celebration hosted by Allu Arjun and Sneha Reddy.

title: The $170bn question: US SC junks Trump tariffs, but who will get the refunds?
content: The Supreme Court invalidated Trump's tariffs, leaving billions in collected duties in limbo. While the administration previously promised refunds, the process remains unclear, with individual importers potentially needing to file lawsuits. This ruling, which affirmed Congress's power to tax, has left companies and countries awaiting further guidance.

title: Caught cheating, told to leave: Student assaults professor in Karnataka college; video viral
content: A student at a Kalaburagi private homoeopathy college attacked a lecturer after being caught copying during an exam. The lecturer confiscated the student's answer sheet and asked him to leave, prompting the enraged student to assault him. The college has barred the student from further exams, but no complaint has been filed.

title: 'Attacked with repeated kicks, punches': Man kills mother over bitter gourd curry in Maharashtra
content: A 37-year-old man allegedly fatally assaulted his 65-year-old mother in Chandrapur after an argument over bitter gourd curry. The accused, reportedly under the influence of alcohol and with a history of dependence, was arrested. The mother succumbed to her injuries at the scene.

title: Effective from February 24: All you need to know about Trump's new 10% global tariffs
content: President Trump signed a proclamation imposing a 10% temporary import surcharge on most goods, effective February 24 for 150 days. This action, taken under emergency powers, aims to address significant balance-of-payments deficits and encourage domestic manufacturing. Broad exemptions are included for economic necessity and national interest.

title: The cardiac Canadians? What we learned from another one-goal thriller for Canada
content: Canada erased a 2-0 deficit to score a late winner and defeat Finland at the winter Olympics . the goal came off of the sticks of two-time Stanley Cup champion Sam Reinhart , shea Theodore and Nathan MacKinnon .

title: How Eileen Gu competing for China is all American
content: the 22-year-old is a sensation in china and a cultural touchstone in the united states . she has made tens of millions off corporations in both countries desperate to be linked to her . a certain beer company might label her the most interesting woman in the world . her fiercest critics might concede to her to critics .

title: Buzz: Tyreek Hill's free agency, Rashee Rice's legal woes and more
content: fantasy football news is viewed from a fantasy perspective . the news cycle will constantly affect player values in fantasy football . our fantasy football Buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the league .

title: How did a West Texas oilman make Team USA's Olympic bobsled team?
content: boone Niederhofer was going to need to do everything necessary to make the 2026 bobsled team . but most everything in his path to that point was atypical, Schwarz said . in 2014, he caught 29 passes for 293 yards and a touchdown .

title: How Premier League clubs look to U.S. to fund big-money signings
content: Gab Marcotti looks at the reasons why premier league clubs were able to pass the £3 billion mark in transfer spending in the summer window . from next season, the league will switch from Profit and Sustainability Rules (PSR) to Squad Cost Ratio (SCR) regulations, marking the latest shift in english soccer's financial landscape .

title: Top moments: United States wins gold medal game over Canada in overtime
content: Emily Kaplan looks ahead to the U.S. women's hockey team's gold medal game against Canada. (0:43) It all came down to this at the 2026 Olympic Games for the two most dominant countries in international women's hockey. The United States and Canada faced off Thursday for the gold medal. After a thrilling back-and-forth game, the U.S. won 2-1 in overtime on a goal by Megan Keller. Women's ice hockey was first introduced at the Olympics in 1998, and these are the only two countries to have won Olympic gold since. Canada won gold four years ago in Beijing, but the U.S. swept this winter's Rivalry Series and defeated Canada 5-0 in the preliminary round. More:   U.S.-Canada is the rematch everyone wanted   |  U.S. favored in gold medal game Here are all the goals and top moments from the game.

title: NCAA men's hockey bubble watch: Who should make the field -- and who will sweat it out
content: six automatic bids to the NCAA tournament will be awarded to the winners of the six conference tournaments . ten more teams will earn at-large spots determined by the NPI formula . the four regional brackets will be announced March 22 .

title: Have F1’s regulations for 2026 made the sport too complicated?
content: f1's new generation of cars haven't completed a competitive lap yet . four-time world champion Max Verstappen likened them to all-electric series formula E "on steroids" a week into the first official preseason test this month . the criticism has extended beyond the two title rivals .

title: ⚾ MLB draft rankings: Who's No. 1 on our list?
content: college players were ranked using the FV (future value) system that I applied for pro prospects . this is the first time we've seen college players in action over the first week of the season . it's time for our first look at who could be high on draft boards in July .

title: 'Inform parents': Gujarat may tweak marriage norms
content: BJP govt in Gujarat proposes amendments to marriage registration rules . couples must inform parents before registering their union . a 'anti-love jihad' amendment would require parents to inform their parents . the proposal was welcomed by the BJP and flagged by legal experts .

title: Red, white, blue and gold? Takeaways from Team USA's dominant win over Slovakia
content: team USA needed overtime to defeat Sweden in the quarterfinal round of the 2026 men's hockey tournament . it took an overtime marker from defenseman Quinn Hughes to put the americans ahead of the final showdown against the U.S.'s primary hockey rival .

title: With Mike Evans declining retirement, where do he and the Bucs stand?
content: he will return in 2026 . he suffered three broken vertebrae in his neck during a preseason game . the Bucs' all-time leading scorer was enduring one of the lowest and loneliest points of his life .
